FuncDef:
The idle-timeout command sets a timeout period to disconnect from the user interface. If no command is entered within the specified period, the system tears down the current connection.
The undo idle-timeout command restores the default timeout period. The idle-timeout command sets a timeout period to disconnect from the user interface. If no command is entered within the specified period, the system tears down the current connection. The undo idle-timeout command restores the default timeout period. By default, the timeout period of the console user interface is 5 minutes and the timeout period of the VTY user interface is 10 minuets.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the time period in seconds to disconnect from the user interface view.
It is an integer data type. The value ranges from 0 to 35791 minutes. The timeout period for a console user ranges from 1 to 1440 minutes, and the timeout period for a VTY user ranges from 0 to 35791 minutes.

Specifies the time period in seconds to disconnect from the user interface view.
It is an integer data type. The value range is from 0 to 59 seconds.

ExtraInfo:
You can run the idle-timeout 0 0 command to disable the idle timeout function of the VTY user interface. If the administrator does not close the operation interface due to negligence, non-administrator users may perform unauthorized operations.
If the idle disconnection function is not configured on the VTY or console user interface, other users may fail to obtain idle connections.
